Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the presence of the KKK in Mebane, N.C. after Trump's victory.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to prove that the KKK marched in Mebane, N.C.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the individuals in the viral photo are members of the KKK, without sufficient proof.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the individuals in the photo were local conservatives supporting Trump, rather than KKK members.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that local media interviewed the individuals in the photo and confirmed they were not affiliated with the KKK.
Understate: The claim understates the actual nature of the individuals in the photo, who were simply local conservatives supporting Trump and not engaging in KKK activities.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misrepresenting the timing of the event, stating it occurred on Wednesday morning when it actually happened on Tuesday afternoon and night.
